sen.j: 当麻皇子（とうまのみこ、生没年不詳）は、6世紀後半から7世紀初期にかけての皇族。
sen.e: Prince Toma (date of birth and death unknown) was in the Imperial family between the late sixth century and early seventh century.
The Prince Toma (year of birth and death unknown) was in the Imperial Family between the late sixth century and the early seventh century.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。date→year,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: The Prince Toma (year of birth and death unknown) was in the Imperial Family between the late sixth century and the early seventh century.
He was also called Prince Maroko.
He was also called the Prince Maroko.
He was also called the Prince Maroko.
His father was Emperor Yomei.
His father was the Emperor Yomei.
His father was the Emperor Yomei.

sen.j: 母は当麻倉日子の娘とも、葛城直磐村の娘とも言われる。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was a daughter of TAGIMANOKURA no Kurahiko (当麻倉日子) or KAZURAKI no Atai Ihamura.
It is said that his mother was a daughter of either TAGIMANOKURA no Kurahiko (当麻倉日子) or KAZURAKI no Atai Ihamura.
sen.cmt: either を補いました。「当麻倉日子」の読みは確認できておりません。ピリオドを修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that his mother was a daughter of either TAGIMANOKURA no Kurahiko (当麻倉日子) or KAZURAKI no Atai Ihamura.

sen.j: 妻は欽明天皇の皇女舎人皇女。
sen.e: His wife was Toneri no himemiko, Imperial princess of Emperor Kinmei.
His wife was Toneri no himemiko, the imperial princess of the Emperor Kinmei.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 Imperial→imperial と修正しました。
sen.e: His wife was Toneri no himemiko, the imperial princess of the Emperor Kinmei.

sen.j: 602年（推古天皇10年）征新羅将軍であった異母兄弟の来目皇子が没した後、翌年の603年4月に征新羅将軍となった。
sen.e: After Prince Kume, a brother by a different mother, who was a general in charge of conquering Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) died in 602, he was assigned as general in May, 603.
After the Prince Kume, a paternal half-brother, who was a general in charge of conquering Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) died in 602, he was assigned as the general in May, 603.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 brother by a different mother→paternal half-brother と修正しました。
sen.e: After the Prince Kume, a paternal half-brother, who was a general in charge of conquering Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) died in 602, he was assigned as the general in May, 603.

sen.j: 難波から船で出発したが、播磨国明石で妻である舎人皇女が没した。
sen.e: He departed from Nanba by ship, but his wife, Toneri no himemiko died in Akashi in Harima province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: He departed from Nanba by ship, but his wife, Toneri no himemiko died in Akashi in Harima Province.
He departed from Nanba by ship, but his wife, Toneri no himemiko died in Akashi in Harima Province.

sen.j: そのため皇女を明石に葬った後引き返したという。
sen.e: Therefore, he buried her in Akashi, and then returned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, he buried her in Akashi, and then returned.
Therefore, he buried her in Akashi, and then returned.
